title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un ready to talk if U.S. drops denuclearization demand
items.description: Kim told North Korea's legislature he's ready to resume talks, adding he had "good memories" of President Trump, despite ongoing tension over Washingt...

items.title: Rheumatoid arthritis kept her captive. This nerve stimulator set her free.
items.description: A new surgically implanted device the size of a lima bean can help control rheumatoid arthritis that isn't responding to drugs.

items.title: What to know as U.N. General Assembly opens, marking 80 years, tackling deep crises
items.description: This year the United Nations is marking its 80th anniversary, but diplomats don't have much to celebrate.

items.title: This small Virginia island could be underwater before the next century
items.description: Tangier Island in Virginia — one of the last inhabited islands in the Chesapeake Bay — is under threat from rising sea levels and climate change.

items.title: Charlie Kirk memorial service honors conservative activist
items.description: President Trump, Vice President JD Vance and Erika Kirk spoke at Sunday's memorial service for Charlie Kirk, founder of Turning Point USA.

items.title: Super typhoon hits Philippines as thousands evacuate
items.description: Ragasa has hit northern Philippines and is barrelling towards southern China.

items.title: 'I'm Kenyan, don't shoot' - the athlete who says he was duped into the Russian army
items.description: Evans Kibet, now being held in Ukraine after surrendering, says he did not know he was signing up.

items.title: Loopholes in hospital charity care programs stick patients with bills
items.description: Even if people qualify for financial help with their hospital bills, the care they receive may not be covered.

items.title: South Korea would accept a Trump-Kim deal to freeze nuclear programme, president tells BBC
items.description: Lee Jae Myung tells the BBC he wants to restore trust with North Korea.

items.title: EU cyber agency says airport software held to ransom by criminals
items.description: Brussels Airport asks airlines to cancel nearly half of their outgoing flights on Monday.

items.title: Botswana declares public holiday after 'historic' athletics gold medal
items.description: President Duma Boko congratulates the men's 4x400m relay team for winning gold at the World Athletic Championships.

items.title: Tourist mistaken for wanted fugitive spends nearly a month in prison
items.description: The tourist found out he shares a name with a wanted criminal, previously sentenced to two years in prison in Italy for aggravated theft.
